courseDescription: Broad overview of exercise science including the history of the discipline and introduction to the following: Healthy People 2010 goals and objectives related to physical activity and nutrition; basic principles of nutrition, body composition, applied physiology, functional anatomy, and exercise prescription/programming for healthy individuals and those who are high risk/diseased; career opportunities in various allied-health fields such as physical therapy, physician assistant, personal training, community/corporate/hospital-based wellness programs, cardiac rehabilitation; and research areas in exercise science.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of basic principles of nutrition
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of physical activity and nutrition objectives
Adjustment of exercise programs for individual needs

courseTitle: Prevention and Care of Injuries Related to Physical Activity
courseDescription: Practice in the skills of injury recognition and evaluation and training in cardiopulmonary resuscitation. Principles and uses of therapeutic modalities are also discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding and application of therapeutic modalities
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing the effectiveness of therapeutic modalities

courseDescription: This course will provide the student with skills in exercise leadership.  The student will learn how to lead resistance training, flexibility training, cardiovascular training involving a variety of exercise modes, and group exercise, such as step aerobics.
Anatomical and mechanical analysis of human musculoskeletal function including skeletal, muscular, and neuromuscular control aspects necessary for movement.
Technical and Digital Skills: Mechanical analysis of human musculoskeletal function
Understanding of skeletal, muscular, and neuromuscular control aspects
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identification and analysis of musculoskeletal issues

courseDescription: An investigation into the metabolic adaptations, neuromuscular, endocrinological, and respiratory responses to acute and chronic exercise endeavors. Implications for enhanced health and physical performance are integrated.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of neuromuscular responses to exercise
Knowledge of respiratory responses to acute and chronic exercise
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex physiological concepts
Ability to communicate the implications of exercise for health and physical performance

courseDescription: Focuses on cardiovascular responses to exercise and applied exercise physiology, specifically the effects of different training modes, environmental factors, aging, disease states, nutrition, and ergogenic aids.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of environmental factors on exercise
Knowledge of effects of aging on exercise
Understanding disease states in relation to exercise
Knowledge of nutrition's effect on exercise
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing effects of different training modes
Evaluating impact of environmental factors on exercise
Assessing the influence of aging and disease states on exercise
Analyzing the role of nutrition and ergogenic aids in exercise

courseDescription: Seminar will include resume and cover letter writing skills, internship requirements, agency placement referrals, interviewing techniques, and certification options.

Final field placement required for all students with an emphasis in exercise science.  Students will be placed in an agency to gain experience in methodologies, administration techniques, and programs specific to their area of emphasis. Minimum of 400 clock hours. (qualifies as a CAP experience)
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of specific programs related to area of emphasis
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate with agency staff and clients
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to apply exercise science methodologies in practical settings
Analysis of the effectiveness of specific programs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management for completing 400 clock hours
Adapting to the workflow and organization of the placement agency

courseDescription: Field-based experience in a fitness or allied-health setting.  Minimum of 200 clock hours.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of fitness testing and evaluation
Familiarity with health and fitness software
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate fitness plans and instructions
Strong customer service skills in a fitness or health setting
Ability to build rapport with clients
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze client fitness levels and needs
Problem-solving skills for fitness plan adjustments and troubleshooting
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Time management skills for managing client schedules
Leadership skills for directing fitness sessions and motivating clients

courseDescription: Independent study of special topics under supervision of faculty.

The focus of this course is on a positive healthy lifestyle designed to enhance the current and future quality of life.  Topics include: proper exercise programs, healthful nutrition, stress management techniques, and avoidance of high-risk health behaviors in order to reduce disease risk and promote healthful aging.  Various laboratory assessments are used to identify health status and recommend remedial approaches.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of health and fitness concepts
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of health and fitness concepts
Ability to guide others in healthful aging techniques
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Development and implementation of remedial health approaches
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and implementation of proper exercise programs

courseDescription: Emphasizes the role of nutrition as a means to enhance health and performance in sport.  Topics covered include energy metabolism and nutrients, regulation of metabolism by vitamins and minerals, and weight control.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of energy metabolism and nutrients
Knowledge of how vitamins and minerals regulate metabolism
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Guiding individuals or teams on nutritional practices

courseDescription: Application of physical laws and mechanical principles to the human musculoskeletal system.
Technical and Digital Skills: Application of biomechanical concepts to the musculoskeletal system
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing physical interactions within the musculoskeletal system
Problem solving using mechanical principles and physical laws

courseDescription: Introduction to the scientific method applied to exercise science research including bioethics, review of the literature, research design, data collection, appropriate statistical analysis, research writing, and peer review.
A study of pathophysiology of common diseases with concentration in the design, implementation and administration of exercise prescription for a variety of chronic diseases.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communicating exercise plans to patients with chronic diseases
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing the connection between various chronic diseases and exercise
Customizing exercise prescriptions based on specific chronic diseases

courseDescription: This course provides an introduction to the principles of administration and implementation of fitness and wellness programs to individuals, groups, centers, and corporate settings. This is a writing intensive course.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Modifying fitness programs based on individual or group needs
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading wellness initiatives in various settings

courseDescription: The study of special topics in exercise science.
Supervised research on a specific problem in exercise science. Regular meetings with faculty and a written/oral report are required.
Technical and Digital Skills: Use of exercise science specific software

courseDescription: Emphasizes the role of nutrition as a means to enhance health and performance in sport.  Topics covered include energy metabolism and nutrients, regulation of metabolism by vitamins and minerals, and weight control.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of vitamins and minerals regulation of metabolism
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and implementing diet plans for athletic performance

courseTitle: Exercise Testing for Normal and Special Populations
courseDescription: The application of different methodologies in the measurement of physiologic responses to exercise.  Emphasis is placed on understanding American College of Sports Medicine guidelines, appropriate experimental techniques, and equipment necessary to evaluate changes in body composition and various metabolic, cardiovascular, and respiratory adjustments during exercise.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of American College of Sports Medicine guidelines
Equipment handling for body composition evaluation
Monitoring metabolic, cardiovascular, and respiratory adjustments during exercise
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication of exercise testing results
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Interpretation of physiologic responses to exercise
Data analysis of body composition changes
Assessment of metabolic, cardiovascular, and respiratory adjustments
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Planning and executing exercise testing protocols

courseDescription: Application of physical laws and mechanical principles to the human musculoskeletal system.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of the human musculoskeletal system
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing physical interactions within the human body
Solving problems related to biological mechanics

courseDescription: A study of pathophysiology of common diseases with concentration in the design, implementation and administration of exercise prescription for a variety of chronic diseases.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Solving problems related to chronic diseases through exercise prescriptions
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading patients through their exercise prescription

courseDescription: An introduction to the principles of administration and implementation of fitness and wellness programs to individuals, groups, centers and corporate settings.
Technical and Digital Skills: Administration of fitness and wellness programs
Implementation of wellness programs in various settings
Understanding of fitness and wellness principles
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis and assessment of individual and group needs

courseDescription: A study of the principles and techniques utilized in optimizing physical performance and reducing injury through proper and effective strength and conditioning programs. Special emphasis will be placed on current research findings, breakthrough techniques and advanced weight training techniques, and popular conditioning practices.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of advanced weight training techniques
Knowledge of strength and conditioning principles
Application of current research findings in physical performance
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Demonstrating proper strength and conditioning techniques
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing effectiveness of strength and conditioning programs
Evaluating physical performance and identifying areas of improvement
Minimizing injury risk through strategic program planning
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Designing and implementing strength and conditioning programs
Staying updated with breakthrough techniques in the field

courseDescription: Review of current physiological literature related to muscular exercise including the cardiovascular-respiratory system, metabolic effects of exercise, neuromuscular relationships, and the effects of training or diet, environment, ergogenic aids, temperature, attitude, and other factors on performance and health.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of metabolic effects of exercise
Knowledge of the effects of training or diet on performance and health
Understanding the impact of environment, ergogenic aids, temperature, attitude, and other factors on performance and health
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to interpret and communicate physiological literature
Presentation of health and performance impacts
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluation of factors affecting performance and health
Problem-solving related to exercise and health challenges

courseDescription: Practice in the use of statistical and analytical techniques in solving problems in exercise science; supervised student research.

Principles of diagnostic exercise assessment, cardiovascular physiology, electrocardiography, ACSM guidelines to exercise testing and prescription for symptomatic and asymptomatic populations. Course includes laboratory assignments.
Technical and Digital Skills: Application of ACSM guidelines to exercise testing and prescription
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Assessment and prescription for symptomatic and asymptomatic populations

courseDescription: This course is an in-depth analysis of the role of nutrition in health and human physical and athletic performance. General areas covered include the role of the six major classes of nutrients in health and sport, physiologic and metabolic interrelationships, malnutrition, nutrition in growing and aging, and diet and nutrition in the prevention of disease.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of nutrients and their roles
Knowledge of malnutrition and its effects
Understanding of nutrition in growing and aging
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Explaining complex nutritional concepts in accessible language

courseDescription: Designed to provide detailed practical experience (200 clock hours) in an exercise science field setting.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Collaborative teamwork in a fitness setting
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Modify fitness programs based on client needs

courseDescription: Selected topic courses in exercise science and wellness.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of the human body and its functions
Knowledge in exercise science and wellness
Ability to use fitness assessment tools
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Adapting exercise routines based on individual needs

courseDescription: Investigations in exercise science. Problems approved in advance are investigated under the supervision of the faculty advisor.
Master's level thesis research in topics related to Exercise Science.
Preparation and writing of the master's thesis.
Technical and Digital Skills: Use of relevant software for data analysis
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Compliance with ethical guidelines in research

courseDescription: Study of the relationships among mechanics, energetics and control of human movement. Emphasis will be placed on the application of mechanical concepts in biomechanics research. Course includes laboratory assignments.
Technical and Digital Skills: Application of mechanical concepts in biomechanics research

courseDescription: A study of the physiology and pathophysiology of the cardiovascular system. Effects of exercise on the system will also be discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of cardiovascular system physiology and pathophysiology
Knowledge of the effects of exercise on the cardiovascular system
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex physiological processes
Ability to discuss and debate the effects of exercise on the cardiovascular system
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing cardiovascular system responses to exercise
Critical evaluation and interpretation of physiological data

courseDescription: This course will focus on the endocrine responses to acute and chronic exercise and how neuroendocrine function relates to health and athletic performance. Emphasis is placed on the role of the endocrine system in regulating substrate utilization during exercise, energy balance, skeletal muscle plasticity, reproductive function, and the aging process.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of endocrine responses to exercise
Knowledge of neuroendocrine function in relation to health and athletic performance
Understanding the role of the endocrine system in regulating substrate utilization during exercise
Understanding of energy balance, skeletal muscle plasticity, reproductive function, and the aging process
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex endocrinological concepts
Ability to explain the relationship between neuroendocrine function and athletic performance
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret and analyze endocrine responses
Ability to assess the role of the endocrine system in various physiological processes

courseTitle: Ergogenic Aids in Sport and Human Performance
courseDescription: An ergogenic aid is any technique or substance (nutritional, drug, etc.) used to enhance mental or physical performance. This course introduces students to the various classes of ergogenic aids and critically explores scientific research regarding their use, prevalence, physiological effects, and safety, as well as ethical concerns.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of various classes of ergogenic aids
Knowledge of physiological effects of ergogenic aids
Awareness of safety measures with ergogenic aids
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to discuss ethical concerns related to ergogenic aids
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluation of prevalence and use of ergogenic aids

courseDescription: Study of the relationships among mechanics, energetics and control of human movement. Emphasis will be placed on the application of mechanical concepts in biomechanics research. Course includes laboratory assignments.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of mechanical concepts in biomechanics
Application of mechanics in biomechanics research

courseDescription: A study of the physiology and pathophysiology of the cardiovascular system. Effects of exercise on the system will also be discussed.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of cardiovascular physiology and pathophysiology
Knowledge of the effects of exercise on the cardiovascular system
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of cardiovascular system responses to exercise
Identification and assessment of pathophysiological changes in the cardiovascular system

courseDescription: This course will focus on the endocrine responses to acute and chronic exercise and how neuroendocrine function relates to health and athletic performance. Emphasis is placed on the role of the endocrine system in regulating substrate utilization during exercise, energy balance, skeletal muscle plasticity, reproductive function, and the aging process.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of endocrine responses to exercise
Knowledge of neuroendocrine function in relation to health and athletic performance
Understanding of the role of the endocrine system in regulating substrate utilization during exercise
Knowledge of skeletal muscle plasticity, reproductive function, and the aging process in relation to exercise
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of endocrine responses to acute and chronic exercise
Evaluation of neuroendocrine function in various health and performance contexts

courseTitle: Ergogenic Aids in Sport and Human Performance
courseDescription: An ergogenic aid is any technique or substance (nutritional, drug, etc.) used to enhance mental or physical performance. This course introduces students to the various classes of ergogenic aids and critically explores scientific research regarding their use, prevalence, physiological effects, and safety, as well as ethical concerns.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of various classes of ergogenic aids
Understanding of physiological effects of ergogenic aids
Evaluation of scientific research on ergogenic aids
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ethical discussions on use of ergogenic aids
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluation of aid effectiveness and safety
Identification and analysis of prevalence trends

courseDescription: This course is a pass/fail course doctoral students may take to maintain active status after successfully passing the candidacy examination.  All doctoral students are required to be registered for at least one graduate credit hour every semester until their graduation.
